items.preText: 1.58pm National anthems done, the openers Liton Das and Tamil Iqbal have jogged out under the sun with a punch of gloves. Matt Henry is going to start the match with two slips in place (once they stop blaring Taki Taki on the loudspeaker). Umpires just checking everything in place, here we go... 1.50pm Napier had started off the series between NZ and India too and hosts had been bowled out for only 157 then. Let's see what's in store today. People logging in from the USA, can also watch the game live right here. Toss: Bangladesh have opted to bat first New Zealand: 1 Martin Guptill, 2 Henry Nicholls, 3 Kane Williamson (capt), 4 Ross Taylor, 5 Tom Latham (wk), 6 Jimmy Neesham, 7 Colin de Grandhomme, 8 Mitchell Santner, 9 Lockie Ferguson, 10 Matt Henry, 11 Trent Boult So compared to the fifth ODI v India, they bring in the fit Martin Guptill for Munro, and Lockie Ferguson for Todd Astle Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Liton Das, 3 Soumya Sarkar, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Sabbir Rahman, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 10 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 11 Mustafizur Rahman They've brought in Sabbir for Shakib 1.25pm The players are warming up, it's nice and sunny because of the open blue skies at McLean Park. We're five minutes away from the toss. Isam informs me this is the first time Steve Bernard is match referee in an ODI between two Full Member nations. He has officiated in six ODIs of Associate Nations in the past. "Good weather here in Sydney, calling in Sick at work to watch the amazing contest. Go Tigers !" Want me to e-mail your boss, Risad? Asif iqbal: "From Bangladesh, I usually go to sleep at 4am.it's 6.30 now and I cant decide if I should get some sleep or watch the game" Wait for the toss, at least Yousuf: "Ola bomdia ! Is mean good morning from portugal just got back from work and eagrly wating to enjoy the crunchy contest between tigers vs kiwis" Sachchu Khan : "Here is father and daughter from Toronto, Canada. 7:28pm now. I've to go to work & my daughter has to go to school tomorrow morning. How long it'll take finish?" Tanbir: "To be honest we are likely to loose this series by 3-0 All I want is Bangladesh to put a fight before they loose. Come on BD" A doze of optimism in the morning Jamiur Raja: "Now Bangladesh is a brilliant and experienced team. I hope, they will win." 1.15pm To add to Bangladesh's worries, they played a warm-up game three days ago in Lincoln and were bowled out for 247, with decent knocks only from Mushfiqur, Mahmudullah and Sabbir Rahman. The visitors will have to pick themselves up quickly. Sumon biswas: "Very excited! Is Fizz would be bowling first time in NZ soil ?" Nope, he has played four matches here already - two ODIs and two T20Is - with five wickets at an average of 29. Samin Khandaker: "Hello Vishal and Hello NZ... it's 7:00 PM here in New York! Bangladeshis here are as crazy for cricket as back in Bangladesh! This will be a good contest." Mahmnur : "It looks like standard start from South Korea where local time now 9:13am...good mood on cricket during research in Laboratory. Good luck Bangladesh " Juwel Ahmed: "I'm from uk . 12:16am here staying up for the game got work tomorrow as well but still want to watch the game " Shohag : "From canada. We love our cricket a lot. Tigers need to step up in absense of shakib. Eagerly waiting to get home and watch this beautiful game." Sohel Azad: "Good morning NZ & BD . Here in Switzerland 01:00PM , wherever or whenever we are , we are crazy fan eagerly waiting for new series, hope for the best Tigers!!!" 1pm Good afternoon New Zealand, and very good morning to all those who've woken up already in Bangladesh (it's 6am there), and good day to all those reading this from anywhere else, for the start of the three-match ODI series. Welcome to our ball-by-ball coverage of the first match in Napier, I'm Vishal Dikshit, and I'll be joined by Varun Shetty soon, once he stops snoozing his alarm. We're about 30mins away from the toss. Many would have thought of this being a series New Zealand could be counted on to win, given how they perform at home, their 4-1 ODI series loss to India has changed things a bit. Some holes in their line-up have been made wider: Will Tim Southee be able to find form before the World Cup? Should they keep backing Colin Munro to open with Martin Guptill? Can they handle spinners, especially if pitches are dry in England in the World Cup? They, will, however, be slightly upbeat after winning the T20I series 2-1 against India. Bangladesh are a different force in limited-overs cricket, they beat New Zealand in the Champions Trophy in 2017, but they are without the Man of the Match from that game - Shakib Al Hasan. Can Bangladesh lift themselves on foreign soil with the help of their pace attack to threaten New Zealand in a three-match series? You can also read Isam's preview here since he knows the Bangladesh team better than many.
items.text: shortish down the leg side, poor line to start the match, and Tamim merely tucks it off his pads, fine enough for a four
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, FOUR runs

items.text: much better line. Angles it away a bit, well outside off on length so left alone
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Runs in for the third ball and then withdraws near the crease. Replays now showing he had twisted his ankled a bit on the first delivery
items.text: short of length on middle stump, no room and Tamim helps it to midwicket
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: opens Tamim up a bit with an accurate line on off stump, he opens the face of the bat and runs it to third man
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: nice and accurate line outside off, Liton defends it watchfully
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.text: bit closer to the off stump now, Liton stays back and defends again
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.preText: Swing king Trent Boult has the other new ball. Two slips remain
items.text: finds swing straightaway, lovely away movement but it's pretty wide and just inside the wide line. Left alone
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: such accuracy, and he strikes! Boult pitches that up on off stump, making Tamim drive but there's some outswing and he's edged it to the keeper. Tamim, though, was driving with a closed bat towards the leg side, instead of driving it straight down the ground. Boult did his job though with the length, the away movement and the edge
items.shortText: Boult to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal c †Latham b Boult 5 (5m 6b 1x4 0x6) SR: 83.33

items.text: right in the block hole now to welcome the new batsman. No margin for error whatsoever and Soumya digs it out of the ground
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: almost a replay of the Tamim wicket delivery and Soumya watchfully blocks it by getting behind the ball
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: that's short and Soumya does well to get on top of that and pull that away to the square-leg boundary. Not sure what Boult tried with the short ball but it was a bit too short and Soumya pulled it away with style
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: back to his outswingers outside off and the batsman lets it go but withdrawing his bat just in time
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: on the pads, loud appeal from Henry, but it's angling in a fair bit after pitching on middle and would've probably missed. Liton tried to clip it away to leg but missed and was hit on the front pad in front of leg
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.text: teases him with an away-swinger outside off, he pokes and misses
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.text: bangs it in short, there's some nice shape too, and Liton stays back to defend it on his toes
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, no run

items.text: angles it in towards the stumps again with a length delivery, Liton helps it to fine leg with a thick inside edge
items.postText: Liton not looking too confident against Henry's pace and swing
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: length delivery on leg stump, Soumya defends it back with his head down
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: bit too wide and what a beauty from Soumya. Stays back absolutely still and caresses that though the cover-point region with a back-foot punch by using the angle of the ball
items.postText: Henry will be disappointed to end the over like that
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.preText: Only one slip for Boult now
items.text: loud, loud appeal for lbw as he swings this one in, Liton hasn't moved his feet at all and is trapped on the back foot. But the ball is bouncing a fair bit and that probably saves Liton
items.shortText: Boult to Liton Das, 1 leg bye

items.text: on the stumps from Boult and he defends it on the leg side
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: creamed through the covers this time, four more! He needs only a bit of room, some outswing, and Soumya leans into that drive to send it rolling along the ground in the gap in the covers
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: back towards the stumps again and Soumya defends it back
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: headed right towards off and middle, Soumya stays back and blocks it off the middle
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: full on off, hint of outswing, and Soumya flicks it to mid-on by just checking his shot
items.shortText: Boult to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText:
Liton takes a fresh guard against Henry, two slips continue

Naim Noor Arnob: "I don't know if it's the correct decision to bat first winning the toss on a swinging surface and against a swinging Boult"
items.text: that's gone right through Liton! No footwork whatsoever from him as the ball nips in from length outside off, he leaves a wide gap between bat and ball, not accounting for the line and the movement, and the ball goes on to clip top of off stump. He was looking out of place against Henry in the previous over and the bowler cashed in on that
items.shortText: Henry to Liton Das, OUT
